characters: OUT OF LADIES' ROOM, AND UP THE RAMP TO THE NEAREST
HE PUSHES IT OPEN, ENTERING THE APARTMENT, CAMERA
TABLE. ALL HELL BREAKS LOOSE. TOMMY ROLLS, THRUSTING TH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter.  A celebration.  Close friends, cop friends, family all here to celebrate patrolman MIKE KEEGAN'S promotion to detective, NYPD. The party spills through the house -- front room, dining room, kitchen, with a small fenced backyard visible beyon that.  A community of cops on their off-hours, their wives, kids.  A mix of generations, all the way from MIKE'S kid, TOMMY, and his FRIENDS, playing among the adults, to an elderly woman observing quietly from her chair at the side.  The mood's warm, spirited; there's a lot of friendship here. ANGLE:  MIKE, in the dining room, posing for a photo with his ten-year-old son, TOMMY, proudly displaying his new gold detective's SHIELD pinned to his jersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to his wife, for a family portrait)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie!  C'mon!  Over here! ANGLE:  ELLIE, MIKE'S wife of fifteen years, a local product, bright and lively, and clearly proud as hell of her man.  She frees herself from the crush of friends, hurrying to join him. ANGLE:  MIKE, ELLIE giving him a full-mouthed smack on th lips as he hooks her into his arms. The picture's snapped, to a chorus of hoots and hollers. Behind, a banner and poster blowup of Mike in gun and uniform read:  "FINALLY THEY'VE RECOGNIZED YOU, DETECTIVE

dialogues.speaker: KEEGAN."
dialogues.text: SCOTTY, a patrolman with the 117th and one of MIKE'S best pals, puts his hand vigorously, in congratulations, on MIKE'S SHOULDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No joke?  You're being transferred to the 19th as your first assignment?  Who the hell loves your ass downtown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (naively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the 21st? BROOKLYN, a cop about Mike's age, joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What d'you care?  You'll never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manhattan.  The Upper East Side, East 59th to 96th. The ROOKIE stares, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember Curran from the Sixteenth? He posted a coupla months there on a floater outside the French embassy. He met Jackie Kennedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curran, that fuckin' noodlehead.  He probably wrote her up for letting her dog dump on Rockefeller's doorstep. ANGLE ON MIKE, trying to swallow a mouthful of potato salad as a plump and pretty middle-aged woman (HELEN GREENING) pulls him into a bear hug, planting a kiss on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmmm-glimmmeee-kisss!  I'm so proud of you!  What the hell took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't ask me.  Ask the man who put in the good word. ANGLE ON T.J. GREENING, Helen's husband, Mike's best friend.  He's forty, stocky, looks up, horsing around wit some of the kids in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If T.J. didn't push for me, I never would've made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet your ass... I give you six weeks before you're back on the beat, Keegan, they got no room for hero cops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appreciate, that vote of confidence, Brook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, am I supportive, or what? ANGLE ON TOMMY:  in the hallway, trying to show SCOTTY'S date -- a "real" BIMBO, who's spilling out of her woolly sweater and tight jeans -- how to stand on his SKATEBOARD She shrieks a laugh, toppling off.  HELEN, passing by wit an empty platter, catches the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE, another WIFE at the sink, wives all; HELEN enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left Elaine for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about little Scotty? ELLIE continues washing the dishes as HELEN and the WIFE dry.  MIKE enters to get more beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still staring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to tie her tits together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wouldn't be too difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overhearing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you think she doesn't have a brain in her head.  I bet you think the only thing he sees in her is one incredible, dynamite body... He GRINS at their blank stares... ELLIE'S EYES wryly following... as he moves on out with his beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love your husband, Ellie, but he's a real dork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but he's my dork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night has descended, PEOPLE talking and laughing quietly, MELLOW music is playing -- CAMERA FINDING MIKE AND ELLIE, dancing close, moving sensually.  It's impressive.  HELEN convinces T.J. to DANCE.  SCOTTY and BIMBO join in too. T.J., whipped, extricates himself and Helen; tousling Mike's hair in affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're goin'.  Get some sleep, Detective Keegan.  You got a new job tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE is holding TOMMY asleep on his shoulder. ELLIE appears, completing the family portrait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I should put the skateboard in bed with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too kinky. MIKE smiles and climbs the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE in the bathroom, the door open, she brushes her hair. MIKE in bed, thoughtful, a happy man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, you know I think it's about time we got outa this place, get us a house of our own.  We can afford it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen to that.  The supermarket's full of assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my advice, don't buy any... MIKE waits for a response.  None comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aware of her change in tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ass if falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your what...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ass is falling.  It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appears in the door; stricken)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just saw it in the mirror, it doesn't look like my ass anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I gonna do?  I jog, I do the exercises on TV in the morning... gravity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a great ass!  I love your ass -- now get that falling ass into bed before it hits the floor. She does -- the lights snap put.  They giggle, she MOVING into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a declaration)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow, I start looking for our house... You love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got no idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine... I'm sleepin' with a DT. Another muted laugh -- and they move into an EMBRACE, CAMERA PANNING WITH THEM, and then STILL FARTHER INTO THE DARKNESS. THE DARKNESS HOLDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Becoming a darkness pricked with light, as WE FLOAT over the reflective river, MOVING WEST TOWARD AND OVER TH CITY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fabled city, the ultimate object of man's desire and fulfillment, Oz, the city unfolding itself before and beneath us, till DAZZLING SHAFTS OF LIGHT sizzling up -- KLEIG LIGHTS -- stab our eyes and bring us down into thei BLINDING BRIGHTNESS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nondescript piece of rundown city block that's the hottest thing in town.  PERSONNEL regulate the CROWD and ARRIVALS.  There is a public line, and from it the young, hip and outrageous can look on while awaiting entrance at the formally dressed, stylishly gowned GUESTS arriving at the private line. A glittering post-Metropolitan Museum of Art opening gala is in progress tonight.  The club's private entrance look like what it once was, a shuttered porno bookstore, and the joke's not lost on most of the formal GUESTS, arrivin through the X-rated doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The latest achievement of money, rock and art.  It's a breathtaking multi-leveled theater of light, sound and dance. There is also an entrance-by-invitation-only grand salon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUESTS arriving here for the Met gala enter almost in enchanted procession, each of them being personally greeted by the primary owner and manager of the club, WIN HOCKINGS, a charming, rakish ex-preppy.  WIN stands in th middle of the floor in the throw of a spot, greeting. This is his element and his club, a son of old money, and a crossover creature to the fast life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... nice to see you... thank you... my pleasure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (effusively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much for agreeing to host us tonight.  It's really extraordinary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad I could be of help. CAMERA MOVING IN ON A NEW ANGLE, CLAIRE GREGORY and NEIL STEINHART.  The way our CAMERA covers them makes it clear they are major characters in our story.  NEIL steps forward to introduce himself, but WIN, looking up, spots CLAIRE first:  A special beauty and clearly someone very special to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Win. And he embraces her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (introducing her companion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Neil Steinhart? He grins broadly, taking NEIL'S hand; then right back to CLAIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the filthy rich Steinharts?  Why is it Claire always connects with the richest men this side of Saudi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Win; meaning the club)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gives new meaning to the word nightlife. WIN acknowledges the obligatory compliment with a closed smile, impatiently returning to CLAIRE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's get outa this lowbrow rag trade... (smiles, cutting Neil out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mind, do you? NEIL stares, polite, as WIN whisks her away; turning, as he is addressed by someone else coming his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a BLACK PORSCHE PULLS UP, its dark-tinted window rolling down TO REVEAL JOEY VENZA.  The MANAGER of the club comes over to him, with a clipboard list of only the invitees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a dilemma)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Venza... VENZA jams the ACCELERATOR to the FLOOR, the CAR burning rubber like a DRAGSTER as PEOPLE SQUEAL and JUMP OUT of the way; the CAR fish-tailing away, screeching AROUND the CORNER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIN and CLAIRE.  The music, noise, other conversations ca still be heard as they walk through the club. He smiles, mid-conversation; there's a real affection here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skiddy and Kit?  I haven't seen them since that shitty pasta dinner on the cape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got two monsters now.  Both boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so what's with Steinhart?  Is it serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't like him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks a little constipated to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (needling him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called "solid"... Nice to find someone you can count on, Win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VENZA entering, a rush, NOISE and ACTIVITY from the alley outside; the throbbing new MUSIC overhead.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY VENZA
dialogues.text: Immaculate as always, in a conservatively-cut European pinstripe, VENZA strides tautly into the shabby corridors

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIN shows CLAIRE the main dance floor below, sound-filled and crowded, private and paying GUESTS mixing, indistinguishable now.  He raises his voice to be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main floor stays public.  The side rooms we try to keep available for special functions like tonight. He turns and takes her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's terrific Win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still writing the occasional magazine article?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Occasionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then c'mon.  Follow me.  The art's in the basement, you're going to get a privileged peek. He leads her to the freight elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire! A sociable FOURSOME descends on them.  It looks like it's going to be a long conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire, quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just press the button all the way down when you're ready, okay? He turns as she's engulfed, heading towards the elevator, runs into NEIL, CLAIRE'S escort.  NEIL doesn't see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably found somebody nicer... Kidding.  You're great. He smiles, entering the elevator and disappearing from view.  NEIL looking around, with thinly-veiled impatience at the benefit-types streaming into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VENZA navigates the labyrinth that connects to the offices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator reaches bottom.  WIN exits into an area of tall rows of stacked boxes still awaiting unloading. Beyond, a bright, high-ceilinged linen whiteness gleams. It's a soon-to-be restaurant-gallery area.

dialogues.speaker: THE RESTAURANT GALLERY
dialogues.text: The walls have already been painted white.  Tables have been positioned.  Chairs are stacked, waiting.  So are mounds of folded laundry and tablecloths, boxes of accessories, glass and dish and kitchenware, etc. Except for FRED, the elderly stock boy, the bright silenc is empty. FRED scores open the sealed cardboard cartons with a curved case cutter.  Several tablefuls of unloaded servers, kitchen utensils, etc., bear witness to the size of his job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in overtime, Freddy. FRED nods, putting down his case cutter, using a side exit. WIN, left alone, turns to look up proudly at his powerhouse modern art collection lining the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE extricating herself; to the foursome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will... I promise... She smiles graciously and steps into the freight elevator pushing the down button.  The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VENZA approaches an intersection.  Ahead, FRED crosses on his way to the offices.  The elderly STOCK BOY doesn't se VENZA, but VENZA sees him, realizing where else to look here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE closes her eyes, leaning back against the metal walls, taking advantage of the refuge for the moment. Music and crowd noise still vibrate.  The elevator, shuddering, continues its descent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIN turns in the silence, looking out over the bright space edged by darkness, every reason to be pleased. WIN doesn't even hear VENZA enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bear, icily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need money, you come to me. WIN turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching, soundlessly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck do you think you are, raising cash without coming to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ex-partner... I'm buying you out, Joey.  Read the contract. There's ample provision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the contract!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator arrives.  The doors open.  CLAIRE steps out into the shadowed area of stacked rows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares, wildly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years ago you were begging me for the money.  Nobody would've touched you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making an eighty percent return.  Which is what you wanted. WIN turn away from VENZA.  VENZA grabs his arm violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't turn away when I'm talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat with deliberation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grease and water still don't mix, Joey.

dialogues.speaker: VENZA
dialogues.text: slashes one of the canvases (A Rosenquist) with the case cutter... Then another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venza slashes another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey!

dialogues.speaker: VENZA
dialogues.text: turns, slashing WIN.

dialogues.speaker: WIN
dialogues.text: gasps.  Blood begins to seep from his wound.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: hearing, emerges into the light, smiling, thinking WIN'S saying something she's supposed to respond to.

dialogues.speaker: VENZA
dialogues.text: slashing WIN again, losing all control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staggering back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...!

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE ROUNDS THE CORNER
dialogues.text: Seeing WIN, she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VENZA continues to attack him, stabbing WIN to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: screams, unable to imagine or believe it.

dialogues.speaker: VENZA
dialogues.text: looks up, hearing her. WIN sprawls, a lifeless, bloodied mass at VENZA'S feet. VENZA stares, returning CLAIRE'S stare, trying to concentrate, to focus and pull himself back together.  He puts down the cutter, taking a step toward her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: steps back, turning and moving back toward the elevator, running.

dialogues.speaker: VENZA
dialogues.text: quickens his step, after her.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: as she REACHES IT and HURTLES inward, HITTING all the BUTTONS, the doors beginning to RUMBLE CLOSED.  But VENZA is there, THRUSTING HIS HAND INSIDE to stop them.  The doors CLOSE on his fingers.  He cries out, pulling his fingers free.  He slams his fist against the doors as the close shut, POUNDS the button again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But CLAIRE grabs the POWER SWITCH, pulling it -- the elevator goes dead, the overhead lights go out -- and somewhere, in the shaft above, an ALARM BELL begins to RING. Relentlessly, VENZA pounds on the other side of the door.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: giving way in the darkened cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: sagging against the elevator wall, weeping, hearing VENZA'S FRANTIC BREATHING on the other side subside, and finally move away in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGING -- a hand fumbling on the telephone in the darkness.  WE HEAR MIKE'S VOICE as he turns on the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J...?  Is this a joke?  Are you kidding me? (listening, not liking what he hears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me 20 minutes. MIKE hanging up the phone, turns to ELLIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling from under the covers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switch the light off on your way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE and T.J. disheveled and tired, drinking out of styrofoam coffee cups, arriving at the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mike, out of the bag into the bureau, huh... How do you like it so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving a half smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right behind you, T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rare tableau; swirling disco lights reflecting off strategically placed mirrors, illuminating a room filled with POLICEMEN (in uniforms and polyester suits), trying to ride herd on the BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE, in contrasting attire. The man in charge and coping is LIEUTENANT GARBER; in plainclothes, fiftyish, rough-hewn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever hear the chatter. They're worse than fuckin' four- year-olds... Miller, let's clear this path here, all right? T.J. and MIKE arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to them, on the move)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood bath downstairs.  The owner of this place is dead.  And I got a witness, and a suspect... Joey Venza. T.J. reacts to the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Venza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice question.  I like questions like that. A massive "GASP" goes up from the CROWD as a cumbersome BODYBAG is brought up a stairwell from downstairs.  GARBE temporarily moves away to oversee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to T.J.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Joey Venza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad fuckin' news.  Even the families dropped him when they found they had a fruitcake on their hands.  But he knows where a lot of bodies are buried.  It'd cap it for Garber if he could bring him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returning, re: the crowd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's find out what we know. Herd'm up and check'm out.  Anybody know more than gossip about the deceased or Venza, I wanna talk to them myself.  Go. T.J. moves into action with typical "T.J. style" diplomacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, will all the beautiful people shut the fuck up, before it starts gettin' real ugly here! The uniformed COPS take their cue, moving in for quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mike, the "new boy")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keegan, go baby-sit the witness. Just sit and look impressive.  Make her feel protected.  And if you can get her boyfriend outa my hair, I'll promote you to fuckin' Joint Chiefs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A uniformed COP guarding the door as MIKE approaches, flashing his shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit playing with yourself, Keegan. I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Detective's supposed to identify himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dim, lit only by a desk lamp, CLAIRE seated o a couch, catatonic, NEIL kneading her hand, trying to comfort her.  A KNOCK at the DOOR:  NEIL JUMPS UP to open it -- MIKE ENTERING before he gets there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in charge here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked for the man in charge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be Lieutenant Garber, and he's very busy upstairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me he's "busy".  I asked for an ambulance for this woman and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she injured?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. MIKE gets his first view of her as she TURNS her head int the light.  It is an almost storybook vision of beauty that emerges from the darkness around her; her vulnerability penetrates to the very core.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to talk to anyone without a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not a suspect, sir, she's a witness.  Could I ask you to step outside, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I will not step outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I am just trying to do my job, it's standard procedure to question the witness alone.  Help me out here, could you please leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (icily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really see what that has to do with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadened; to Neil)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, do what he says. ANGLE ON MIKE AND NEIL:  at a standoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. MIKE OPENS THE DOOR for NEIL.  NEIL reluctantly swallows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right outside. NEIL grudgingly leaves.  MIKE quietly closes the door. ANGLE CHANGE:  CLAIRE and MIKE alone.  He sits down.  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you a cup of coffee or something? Her plaintive eyes turning to meet his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lost)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen anyone killed before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay... I've never been a detective before either... She lifts her gaze quizzically, catching his smile.  She returns it in spite of herself, disarmed by his frankness and curiously reassured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go slow.  Okay?  We'll get through it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHONES RINGING, TYPEWRITERS TYPING, BODIES moving at cross-current -- CAMERA FINDING LIEUTENANT GARBER, hustling through the bullpen, MIKE FOLLOWING, toward his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you did it, but whatever it was, keep doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just sat and listened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe and secure is how we want her. Until she I.D.'s Venza. T.J. has joined them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venza's either going to skip or try to get to her and Venza likes it here.  I want her ass covered, 24 hour protection, but I don't want her to know there is any real danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like what I'm hearing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Garber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.  If there's any danger, why not just level with her... GARBER turns back to MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with mock tolerance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. your friend's a little dense. When she realizes there's a killer tryin' to shut her up, she'll be on the next plane for Tahiti... somehow I think my way is better. He MOVES ON, leaving them not very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief? GARBER turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not Patrol?  They'd do just as good a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I want your advise, Keegan, I'll make an appointment. GARBER MOVES ON OUT.  MIKE and T.J. left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  A Nursemaid!  My first detail, and I'm a fuckin' slug! (turning to T.J.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a 'choice' at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, or look for another profession.  That's a choice I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You in this with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  Seniority gets the day shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE IS SEEN unloading groceries from the rear of a smal hatchback...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE is in the kitchen; he's making eggs in agitation, throwing in everything he can find (tuna fish, chopped pickles, mustard), his kid, TOMMY, in evidence in the b.g., on a SKATEBOARD, whizzing through the kitchen, even RIDING IT down the STAIRS. MIKE MOVES TO A CABINET -- and his FEET GO OUT FROM UNDER HIM.  He's slipped on a SKATEBOARD -- barely catching himself in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy!  Goddamnit!  Get these skateboards off the goddamn kitchen floor! TOMMY whizzes through, expertly picking it up "on the move," MIKE taking a futile swipe at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're we having?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My special, scrambled eggs surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowns dubiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrambled eggs surprise? TOMMY goes whizzing on out again.  ELLIE comes in loaded up with the groceries.  Puts them down, giving MIKE a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not great.  I've got a babysitting job for a material witness on a homicide. It explains his mood.  ELLIE starts putting away the groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Til they pick up the perp. (he sits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seniority gets day shift... You know what that means. CLOSE ON ELLIE:  she sits, realizing, upset, but taking i in stride, now putting plates on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll live with it, I've lived with it all my life.  My Dad was a cop, he said, "whatever you do, honey, never go out with a cop". So, what did I do?  I got a job with the cops.  Then I married a cop.  I probably gave birth to a cop. (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy!  Come over here and eat, it's hot. TOMMY enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you and Tommy should stay with my Mom. ELLIE makes an expression of dislike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start... The only reason is that the neighborhood's shi... (realizing that Tommy is listening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... crummy.  I just don't like the idea of leaving you alone here at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can still use a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep it someplace safe, but handy. TOMMY joins then at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (zooming in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep what handy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun?  It's in the upstairs closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know where the gun is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where everything is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except the goddamn skateboards, which are everywhere!  I'd like to kill the guy who invented those things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay back, Mack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay back, Mack!!  What's this "lay back, Mack?" (to Ellie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does he get this? Silence; they eat... ELLIE'S eyes finding MIKE'S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the weekends for us, huh?  Get a replacement for Saturday nights. That'll give us the weekends together. TOMMY'S face screws up, tasting the lump of food in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God!  Scrambled eggs surprise?! These are pickles...!  God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just "lay back, Mack"... lay back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike emerges from the subway alongside the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out front, the DOORMAN opens the door for the building's children returning from music lessons. Across the street in Central Park, handsome, elderly tenants stroll in the company of their nurse:  a nanny pushes a pram, taking advantage of the last light.  This is one of New York's most exclusive co-ops.  Distilled civilization and quiet wealth.  A world away from Queens or anything else.  MIKE arrives on foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A notice behind the locked front door informs:  "ALL VISITORS MUST BE ANNOUNCED".  MIKE displays his shield to the DOORMAN through the glass.  The DOORMAN opens, taking the time to inspect his credentials before returning them then STEPS ASIDE, allowing ENTRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE rides up in silence, examining the ornate walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator delivers him.  MIKE finds himself in a wall- papered trompe l'oeil foyer.  Nothing to get his bearings The front door clicks open, startling him.  MARY, the cleaning lady, an older, capable woman in functional civilian clothes, greets him matter-of-factly, taking him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marble-floored and high-ceilinged, absolutely palatial; MIKE'S EYES registering amazement as he's led inward. Floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking Central Park, where the VOICES are REVEALED belonging to GARBER, T.J., CLAIRE and CLAIRE'S boyfriend, NEIL -- who's trying his best to be "in charge".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching Mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember Detective Keegan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (expressionless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. The doorbell RINGS AGAIN:  MARY goes to answer it as MIKE mumbles his greetings to all -- noticing that CLAIRE, reclining on a couch, seems extremely put out -- or is it "disinterested"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to make sure that everyone respects the privacy of Miss Gregory's household.  You're limited to the outer vestibule, so you can watch the elevator, the kitchen, so you can get something to eat, and the washroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath to Mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can take a shit. The THIRD DETECTIVE enters, being led by MARY.  It's KOONTZ, a package of razz and sarcasm, somebody you definitely don't take home to mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacting; to T.J.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Koontz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be happy.  He's good at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Neil)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like to, just once, get a look at the entire layout, so we can evaluate security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This really isn't necessary.  The security in this building is about the best in the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ever the diplomat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you're right, Miss Gregory, but I'd consider it a favor if you'd let us look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be my guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his troops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: as GARBER withdraws; MIKE, T.J., KOONTZ to start their check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Garber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about when she goes out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discourage it.  But stay with her if you can't.  Call it in first so we can have a car on tail.  She's agreed to travel only with her own driver and limousine... okay, let's check it out. They split up.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: following orders, continues down the hall.  He moves to a door that he ATTEMPTS TO OPEN -- discovering it's not real.  It's a TROMPE L'OEIL.  He turns around to find he' not alone in the long hall.  NEIL stands just outside the living room, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the "door")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: turns, returning to CLAIRE in the LIVING ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why an I reminded of the Three Stooges?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KOONTZ checking the windows and terrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE, MARY the MAID in there with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (officiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a vegetarian?  Miss Gregory's a vegetarian, so I'm gonna put food for you people in a separate fridge. You know how to use a microwave? (before he can answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just about everything you'd want will heat up by turning this to ninety seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utterly sumptuous; T.J. uttering a low "whistle" of awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an enormous circular bathtub and a Jacuzzi, endless mirrors, a writing desk, carpeted, a place one could spend one's life in -- MIKE SEEN, in the MIRRORS, wandering through -- idly pushing a mirrored door open, t gaze, in awe, at the walk-in closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A. ANGLE:  He see T.J., or what he thinks is T.J., reflected among the other reflections at the other end of the room. Sees T.J. sit on edge of bed.  MIKE is standing in center of the MIRRORS, slightly disoriented.  And T.J. sees him, similarly astounded, MOVING OUT OF SHOT. CLOSE ON MIKE:  Moving inward, he gawks at the racks of clothes, gently brushing his hand through the lush fabrics.  CLAIRE'S VOICE -- ANGRY, ALMOST TREMBLING, A FIRM EFFORT OF WILL -- rustles the silence behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my dressing room, and these are my clothes. (holding herself firm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand your responsibilities... but I'd appreciate you staying out of here at all times. MIKE:  chastened, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  Just checking. He starts away.  MOMENTARILY baffled by the MANY-ANGLED REFLECTIONS OF HIMSELF in the MIRRORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to find doors in this place. MIKE:  embarrassed, apologetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Detective Keegan, I hope you understand how upsetting this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All silent; MIKE on "watch".  Just him and a wooden desk chair, the grade-school variety.  No books, no crossword puzzles; he came unprepared.  He checks his watch and looks to an ornate wall clock.  And he's bored.  He picks up an empty coffee cup, looking for a last drop.  Settles for sniffing it.  Replaces it on the floor beside him. Then he looks to the closed doors of the apartment and makes a decision.  Picking up the coffee cup, he quietly pushes the DOORS OPEN, and ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As MIKE pads quietly across the marble floors in the quiet; pausing to gaze, in awe, at the vast, empty LIVING ROOM.  It is gigantic, his eyes roaming the ceilings, as though to estimate their height. Moving inward, his eyes fall on a BOOK RACK, and he crosses to it, perusing the shelves for possible reading material. They're all ART BOOKS, the big, thick kind.  A Renoir, because of a NUDE FIGURE on the cover, catches his eye. But as he pulls it out and begins to leaf through -- he HEARS VOICES.  CLAIRE'S and NEIL'S; her tone is agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... just saying you should think twice about it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't want to talk about it... CLOSE ON MIKE:  book under his arm, quietly moving toward the SOURCE:  the DEN.  It's door is slightly ajar; there is a suitcase in front of it, ready for travel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You know, and I know, that the only thing standing between a life sentence for Venza and his freedom is my testimony at his trial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He killed Win... he enjoyed it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Win made his choices, Claire.  We all do --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm making mine. She looks at him; a beat, emotionally.  He remains steady

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dealing with a psychopath. He gets out of jail in ten years, or five... or ninety days, and you'll be looking over your shoulder for the rest of your life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do?!  I saw one of my oldest friends get killed! And I saw who did it! (through tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't just -- "let it go away"!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire... ANGLE - DEN.  NEIL takes her in his arms, holding her tightly, affectionately, protectively.  Holding her from behind, NEIL KISSES CLAIRE gently on her neck.  She calms in his arms. RETURN:  MIKE DODGES back quickly, through the living and dining rooms until he's in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotting the microwave, MIKE QUICKLY TOSSES in an English muffin -- peering at the dials, as he switches it on. But he hasn't escaped being a trespasser to what's going on in the far room.  He can still HEAR THEM, though HE WHISTLES, trying not to. The English muffin BURSTS INTO FLAMES, MIKE desperately pulling it out, tossing it into the sink, feverishly fanning the air. ANOTHER ANGLE ON MIKE:  becoming aware that HE'S NOT ALONE.  He TURNS SUDDENLY to see MARY, the housekeeper, not ten feet from him, in the laundry room, coat on, fluffing her collar, ready to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chagrined)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like 'em toasty. ANGLE ON MARY:  staring at him, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Mr. Keegan. She moves through the kitchen and EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEIL, with his briefcase, finally leaving.  He crosses from the hallway. The TWO EYE EACH OTHER:  MIKE attempting a cordial smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here 'til what time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm relieved at 4:00 A.M. NEIL noticing the Renoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're through with it, put it back, please, exactly where you found it, and don't use the library again.  I have to leave town for a few days.  Let's do everything we can to make this less of a trial for her, shall we? MIKE NODS.  But when NEIL leaves, he makes a mock "military salute"; a click of the heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2:45 A.M. (the clock ON THE WALL); pindrop silence; MIKE alone. CLOSE ON MIKE:  thoughtful, leafing through the Renoir. Like a man making the most of solitary confinement -- becoming aware of a NOISE.  Though hard to make out in this windowless capsule, it is DISTANT THUNDER.  It stirs life in him and his eyes wander reflexively upward, studying the ceiling -- then the doors of the apartment, left slightly ajar. ANGLE INSIDE THE APARTMENT:  CAMERA FOLLOWING MIKE as he wanders inward, becoming aware of light coming from a drawing room.  HE MOVES TOWARD, STOPPING. ANGLE FROM HIS POV:  CLAIRE, dimly illuminated by the light of a desk lamp that throws a gentle glow around her -- seated, still as statuary, gazing out into the rain. CLOSE ON MIKE:  watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The uncivilized hour indicated by the TOTALLY EMPTY SUBWAY, MIKE a lone figure, somewhat numbed, his eyes set into distant space -- as the SUBWAY reaches its DESTINATION, the blurry platform signs decelerating until we can make out the word "QUEENS".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighborhood still asleep in the predawn hour; MIKE picks up the newspaper... glancing at it, he opens it, sees an article and photograph of CLAIRE on the second page.  He heads inwards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afternoon sunlight SPILLING IN as MIKE AWAKENS to the SOUND of a CAR MOTOR, faltering, then "chug-chugging" to another start, gasping, then revving.  Someone's working on MIKE'S car.  He looks at his alarm clock; it's 4:00 in the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE and TOMMY visible only as fragments as they work on MIKE'S car.  ELLIE IS SEEN as a rear-end in blue jeans, the rest of her inside the hood; she calls to TOMMY to "try it again".  It looks like no one's behind the wheel; but the very top of his head CAN BE SEEN as he strains to reach the accelerator. ANGLE ON MIKE:  appearing at the door, in a freshly pressed suit, a steaming cup of coffee in hand.  He walks across the lawn towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  What the hell're you doin' to my car? ELLIE emerges from underneath the hood, flushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Changing the sparks.  They showed it on TV.  What d'you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think television's a dangerous thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's twenty bucks in the bank. Slamming the hood.  TOMMY revs the engine ELLIE moving down the steps towards MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough, Tommy!  C'mon.  Get out of there! ELLIE moving towards MIKE, she slipping her hand into his underpants:  Their eyes meet, lovingly.  She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  The neighbors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let 'em eat their hearts out. She retrieves her cold coffee cup from the POTTING TABLE, checks out the picture of CLAIRE in the newspaper, he's left there.  MIKE adjusts his tie.  It's very colorful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read the article.  You didn't tell me she was so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mister Honest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, actually, she looks better than that. ELLIE playfully makes a move, JABBING AT HIM, MIKE stops her, ending WITH A HUG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go. MIKE kisses her.  ELLIE holds MIKE'S face with her gloved hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you Tommy. ANGLE ON ELLIE:  as TOMMY comes up and leans against his mom:  both watching MIKE primp, they share on the joke. MIKE turns, his face with grease on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievably handsome.  You look fantastic in a suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice threads Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think so. MIKE leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WALL CLOCK reads 6:30.  The remains of a teeny gourme meal, before him on the kitchen table. MIKE is playing an improvised hockey game, shooting peas through a goal made up of two water glasses, using his knife as a hockey stick.  He HEARS the CLICK of HIGH HEEL approaching, crossing the vast marble floors. ANGLE FROM HIS POV:  CLAIRE coming toward -- clearly dressed for the evening, her stride signaling determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brilliant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I'm not sure how this works.  I have to go out... is that all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unprepared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to pick something up before Bergdorf's closes, then stop at a reception just a few blocks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faltering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think, maybe, that isn't such a great idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Garber said that in all likelihood there was no real danger, is that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  That's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we go then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to call in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a phone in the car. She MOVES TOWARDS THE ELEVATOR:  MIKE, stymied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They descend in silence, MIKE aware of being scrutinized. The ELEVATOR STOPS, MIKE about to get off, realizing they're stopped at the THIRD FLOOR, another TENANT stepping on.  He's dressed in an expensive JOGGING SUIT, his key dangling from around his neck; he nods to CLAIRE and pushes "DOWN".  The elevator RUMBLES downward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have another tie?  Something more conservative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused, then realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Yes... I don't have it with me.  It's at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JOGGER first out the door, taking off with fierce determination, followed by MIKE, who nervously checks the street, then opens the limo door and checks inside, then, finally, MOTIONS CLAIRE OUT.  She moves smoothly into the limo; MIKE checks traffic behind them, then gets in, after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE fumbles, searching the console for the car phone. She finds it easily, picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARBER is on the other end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, what a fucking lunatic. Fucking shopping. (he thinks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see that we have much choice.  Jesus Christ.  Tell her she's a fucking lunatic. GARBER slams down the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE sets down the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks you're being a little careless.  He made the point several times. MIKE sets down the phone.  They settle back; trying to feel "comfortable" in one another's presence.  It's plent awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live in Manhattan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queens... You know Queens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father founded a music school there.  The Milton Gregory School. He politely tries to place it, with no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to speak at their tenth anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.  Maybe you'll stop by... have an aperitif... It evokes a slight smile but nothing more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo pulling up, MIKE hopping expertly out before it stops moving. It's parked in a red zone, with tow-away signs everywhere a PATROLMAN notices from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the driver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move it. He flashes his shield at the PATROLMAN, takes a firm grip on CLAIRE'S elbow, guiding her in.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ENTRANCE DOORS
dialogues.text: MIKE stiff-arms the revolving door, stopping outgoing shoppers to clear the way for CLAIRE; hops over to the fixed door, opening it quickly for her, hustling her effortlessly in, zip. ANGLE:  CLAIRE, taken by it, but not displeased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cross toward the up escalator; she knows where she's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Miss Gregory. CLAIRE steps onto the ESCALATOR; MIKE on alert, scrutinizing the crowd.  He gets on right behind.  They ascend. At the top LANDING, A DARK-SUITED MAN VEERS RIGHT INTO HER.  CLAIRE flinches.  MIKE MOVES PAST HER to the front, quickly handling the guy.  The MAN jumps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I thought this was down... ANGLE ON MIKE; SHAKEN.  CLAIRE giving him a long unsteady look, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE keeping close watch as CLAIRE approves her purchase: a silver frame, containing an inscribed photo of CLAIRE and an elegant older woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you wrap it for me, I'll be back in a moment. CLAIRE walks past MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you come with me please. MIKE follows her. CLAIRE at the TIE COUNTER, points to the tie rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you pick one out, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beg pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since you're going to be my escort, you'll need a new tie. MIKE begins to connect, glancing down again at the tie he's wearing.  CLAIRE selects a TIE, turning to the SALESPERSON, for his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. CLAIRE handing it to the SALESPERSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on my account, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got money. CLAIRE gives a look to the clerk to go ahead with her order.  SALESPERSON goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we had more time we'd work on the suit too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE AND CLAIRE; CLAIRE favorably assessing him in the ne tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look quite elegant, actually. He looks down at it in silence; then, finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife likes this suit. CLOSE ON CLAIRE:  his vulnerability makes her smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly a "big deal," with Kleig lights and heavy LIMOUSINE and TAXI traffic being directed into place by COPS, some of whom we recognize. ANGLE ON A PAIR OF COPS, using flashlights to guide traffic -- spotting CLAIRE'S LIMOUSINE with the BLACK-AND WHITE PATROL CAR following it, and signaling it into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Claire's limo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it in, close. The COP OPENS THE DOOR -- stunned to see MIKE STEP OUT, i suit and new tie -- looking like he belongs there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of work?  Gigolo? CLAIRE steps out, utterly elegant, taking MIKE'S arm -- the traffic COPS now joined by those from the BLACK-AND- WHITE, as MIKE and CLAIRE head INWARD.  The COPS wolf- whistle MIKE and razz him as they go, some beginning the STRAINS of "Just a Gigolo"... MIKE GIVES THEM THE FINGER behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE and CLAIRE caught in a crush of people jamming the ENTRANCE WAY -- their bodies coming into close contact, s close that MIKE is forced into an awkward posture in orde to stay close to her; one arm up in the air, uncomfortabl about taking her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can touch me, I won't bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too sure about that. He takes her arm, guiding her through the crowd. The SOUND of a WOMAN'S (MARGE GOODWIN) VOICE attracts their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing through)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE!  Claire!  Darling!  Are you all right? She's a SOCIETY MATRON-TYPE, grabbing CLAIRE in an ever- so-concerned HUG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God!  I couldn't believe... my poor darling... and Win Hockings...! Antonia'll be so happy you're here, she says a "Lifetime Achievement Award" is like being invited to your own funeral while you're still alive... But ANTONIA, an elegant OLDER WOMAN, has already SPOTTED HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire...! She pushes through, and fairly falls into CLAIRE'S arms. ANTONIA almost emotionally overcome, that CLAIRE has managed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have missed it, Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look so beautiful... ANTONIA looks up to see MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mike Keegan, the policeman assigned to protect me.  Antonia Bolt... She looks up to SEE MIKE:  it directs others to do the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (change of tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (introducing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marge Woodwin, Antonia Bolt, this is Mike Keegan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ultra respectful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... (a deferential nod to Antonia)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (liking him; to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got nice eyes.  Very gentle. (re: Mike's embarrassed reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he blushes.  I like that.  Take good care of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE in the thick of things -- a BAND PLAYING NOW -- occasionally glancing at MIKE -- who stands against a wall, ever watchful... CLOSE ON MIKE: TURNING to see a VERY PRETTY YOUNG THING come up to him; just "oozing" seduction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you're a policeman. MIKE nods; eyes fixed on CLAIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.  I'm a policeman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever shot anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it make you... hard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erect.  You know, a "boner?"  I'd heard that it gives you a boner, to shoot a man. MIKE'S eyes register abject dumbfoundment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you excuse me, please? HE PUSHES TOWARD CLAIRE, catching her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you consider leaving here pretty soon? CLAIRE relaxed, clearly having a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People think I'm stepping out on Neil.  We're causing quite a scandal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidential)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  There are crazy people here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... I shouldn't... on duty. She plows toward the crowded bar, just inside the ballroo entrance, MIKE following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a spritzer, order something soft for yourself... I must go for a pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can probably do that on my own. CLOSE ON MIKE:  Not amused.  CLAIRE heads to the ladies' room across from the bar.  MIKE watches her enter.  Turns back to the bar, which is very busy and confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a spritzer, and a... vodka martini. MIKE seeing the Pretty Young Thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it a double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a pair of WOMEN finish their "touch-up" and head out, making way for CLAIRE to step up to the mirror to assess herself.  The room momentarily empties.  Putting her purs down she moves to a stall and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE, waiting, glancing back at the door as the TWO WOMEN EXIT, then turns to the BARMAN to receive the drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE on the door -- as a pair of men's shoes pass through frame. CLOSE ON CLAIRE, inside a stall SHE HEARS FOOTSTEPS QUIETLY ENTER, followed by a CLICK of a DOOR.  It's not the click of a stall door, because the FOOTSTEPS then proceed inward; WE HEAR A STALL DOOR CLOSE and LOCK.  It gives her momentary pause, but she dismisses it, looking for her purse -- realizing she left it on the sink -- opening her stall door and heading out. She barely hears the "click" of the bolt sliding behind her -- and looks up, into the MIRROR, SEEING VENZA appear behind her.  She SPINS -- but doesn't have time to CRY OUT.  He's grabbed her by the THROAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE and the PRETTY YOUNG THING:  she doesn't notice him trying to drift away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what?  I don't think you're a policeman at all.  I think you're just some schmuck who uses that "policeman" line as a come-on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE attempting to breathe -- her FACE being brought to within an inch of his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, you're one beautiful woman. I could kill you right now, but I'm not gonna... 'cause you're gonna help me.  You're gonna see me in a police line-up and say it wasn't me. And if you don't do that, someone will come after you.  They're gonna find you dead, with your face missing -- understood... Good... Because otherwise, it'd be this easy. CLOSE ON CLAIRE:  her eyes wide with TERROR.  He rubs his thumb across her mouth, smearing the lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now walk outta here.  And if you ever see me again... you never saw me before. To make his point, he SQUEEZES HARDER -- CLAIRE'S eyes bulging, as TEARS run from her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE, finally putting distance between him and the "PRETT

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG THING."
dialogues.text: ANGLE:  MIKE, as he catches sight of a back of a man (VENZA) moving out of the ladies' room.  Stunned, MIKE PIVOTS, TURNING, SPRINTING IN THE DIRECTION of the ladies room. OUTSIDE THE LADIES' ROOM:  Two women just go in.  MIKE pushes his way in, slamming the door behind him.  The OTHER WOMEN GASP, seeing MIKE invading their sanctuary.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE LADIES' ROOM
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MIKE:  RELIEVED BUT SHOCKED to see CLAIRE, disheveled, lipstick smeared across her mouth, throat and face, but otherwise uninjured. MIKE turns, calling to the TWO WOMEN coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of her!

dialogues.speaker: UPPER
dialogues.text: ANGLE:  He sees VENZA get into the ELEVATOR.  These is only one place for it to go -- DOWN.  MIKE CHANGES DIRECTION and FRANTICALLY RUNS DOWN THE SPIRALING RAMP trying to keep pace with the descent of the elevator.  At the GROUND LEVEL HE SEES THE ELEVATOR DOORS OPEN and VENZ EXITS AMIDST THE PARTY.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: FIGHTS HIS WAY THROUGH THE CENTER of the PARTY and OUT th FRONT ENTRANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE EXITS the BUILDING bewildered; lost him... RUNS BLINDLY amidst PEDESTRIANS -- SPOTS VENZA AHEAD. ANGLE ON VENZA reaching someone MIKE CAN'T SEE.  MIKE put his hand in his jacket for his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venza! VENZA HEARS and SLOWS, but DOESN'T TURN.  ONLOOKERS turn. VENZA is talking to someone, taking his time. ANGLE ON VENZA:  untroubled, turning; raising his arms, and SMILING. ANGLE ON MIKE:  confused -- seeing that the man VENZA stopped to talk to is a PATROLMAN, he'd stopped to give himself up. CLOSE ON MIKE:  breathless as he moves toward VENZA.  MIK frisks VENZA as he turns, SMILING at MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE and T.J. with GARBER, MIKE being CONGRATULATED by COPS who pass.  But GARBER doesn't look happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protesting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I got him!  He's in jail! Wasn't that the point...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You apprehended him after he gave himself up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a bad bust.  He gave himself up because he knew I was gonna nab him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone who turns himself in makes a good case for bail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Joey Venza?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a good lawyer, and he made a smart move.  We've got a scared witness and a suspect who proved "good will" by turning himself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protesting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about when she identifies him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she identifies him. (turns, unloading on him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck were you anyway, cowboy!  Venza was meat.  He walked right past you, and now we're the ones playing catch-up!  You better hope she identifies him. GARBER turns on his heel, ENTERING HIS OFFICE; leaving MIKE looking at T.J.  Dismayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my fault, T.J.  Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tree-lined neighborhood.  The house has a FOR SALE sign in front; MIKE is standing in front of a cab, he's dresse for work -- he looks around.  The cab pulls out, he heads for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE enters the house.  It's nothing special.  ELLIE is i another room.  She joins MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real estate lady left, she couldn't wait anymore.  What took you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, some shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shit, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to hear about it. ELLIE begins to show him the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Look at the fireplace.  You don't get workmanship like that anymore. ANGLE ON MIKE:  preoccupied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninety-seven five.  What do you think? He nods, trying hard to "be there," but ELLIE isn't fooled; she assesses him with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey.  You got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know that Ellie.  He might get out.  Garber's not bein' straight with the witness, she could be in deep shit if she identifies him, and it's my job to convince her she won't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the voice of sanity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got to identify him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the the only way to stop crime is to identify criminals.  I can't believe you're talking this way Mister Detective -- I think she's got a lot of guts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think -- she's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd identify him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might stop you. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I can see you've had a bad day. We'll see the house another time, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to recover)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  No!  I'm sorry.  Ninety-seven five right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get the tie? He's wearing the tie CLAIRE bought him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she say the down payment was? PAUSE.  DEAD SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't like the other one, so she picked this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She took you shopping for a tie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to follow her to a store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with your paisley tie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, it was a formal party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me!  You went to a party with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm her bodyguard, goddamnit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're her bodyguard.  Did she buy it or did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why she bought me a tie! -- She's a generous person -- and she's a nice person -- and I could be settin' her up to be killed... you want the fuckin' tie? His VOICE resonates through the empty house, creating a ringing silence.  ELLIE begins to giggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't want the 'fuckin'" tie -- I'm sorry -- (conciliatory)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad she bought you a tie.  You needed one.  You look good in that tie. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time you two go shopping, maybe you could tell her we need a new Maytag stackable, double-decker washer and dryer set. MIKE smiles, she gives him a kiss, and a flick on the nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to see the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WALL CLOCK reads 9:45.  CLAIRE is working at her desk She gets up and moves into the hallway where she sees MIK through the half-opened door.  CLAIRE moves to the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Just checking to see if you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came on at 8:00. An awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, that was my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disagreeing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have listened to you, I should've followed you right into the "can" the way he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had known I was going to have company, he was right next to me.  I think he heard me peeing!  I hate that, I am glad he's in jail. She laughs, he smiles, both attempting to make light of it.  But it's hard to make light of; the attempt quickly fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Garber says when I identify him, they're going to lock him up and throw away the key. MIKE nods; buttoning his lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm supposed to do it in the morning.  Identify him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooner, the better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he'd kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big talk... Desperate guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  How could he do that if he's in jail and they've thrown away the key...? MIKE is TORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the right thing to do. Identifying him. She starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up a book)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't happen to know what language they speak in India, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urdu and Hindi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what a woman. He marks it in his CROSSWORDS:  she moves closer,leaning over his shoulder to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't do very well, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope... never finished one yet.  I hate these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were reading my Renoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put it back in the wrong place... Do you like Renoir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're kind of fuzzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why they're like that...? He was myopic... going blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding. In the SILENCE that follows, their eyes on each other, appraising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this could be your last night, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a thought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to go out for a drink? (re: his surprised expression)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, we're both sitting here, and Joey Venza's in jail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I like that!  Where you go, I follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE and MIKE walking; her arm looped in his -- the BLACK-AND-WHITE keeping pace alongside them -- their conversation animated, clearly enjoying one another's company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean to tell me, a mugger would stay away from someone because they walked a certain way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  Look at this. He demonstrates a peculiar walk; arms and legs moving in ridiculous awkwardness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the dumbest walk I ever saw!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no seriously!  There's a study done on this, you walk this way, the muggers are gonna single you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And die laughing, because you're walking so stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock anger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  This is my business.  Do I tell you your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Let's just see if a mugger gets me. She takes off down the street; walking stupidly, worse than he did -- he's LAUGHING as he WATCHES HER GO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COPS following exchange dubious glances, getting a glimpse of the strangeness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FINDING CLAIRE and MIKE, at a small table, in darkness, a piano bar playing in the background.  The son being sung is "SOMEONE TO WATCH OVER ME."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It was like... the minute I saw her... I knew.  She looked so damn adorable in a cop's uniform... puttin' on a big, tough act...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it was "love".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  It was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And "is"...? He hesitates; but nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confirming it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice.  And you live in Queens?  With a child, and a dog...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you with a dog, in my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But "nice".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice. Her envy is plain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Neil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like him, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's to like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell it like it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's very caring, in his way.  You haven't seen him at his best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could do better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll miss you, Mike... ANGLE ON BOTH:  the music playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nice having you "watch over me"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I liked being around you too... Claire. CLOSE ON MIKE:  feeling a moment of awkwardness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PATROL CAR keeping pace as the two walk home; the COP in the BLACK-AND-WHITE exchange a look at what they are seeing.  MIKE is holding her arm, she's huddled up; she i cold and he removes his topcoat and puts it around her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PATROL CAR comes to a STOP as MIKE and CLAIRE ENTER. ANGLE ON THE TWO COPS AGAIN:  watching them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they ride up in silence -- on opposite sides of the elevator -- looking at each other.  It comes to a stop, and neither moves; the tension is palpable. She steps out first, he follows.  She moves to the doors and stops -- her shoulders visibly relaxing as he moves u behind her.  But he stops, too.  And she turns. ANOTHER ANGLE:  Both captive to indecision.  It is he who makes it, just by staying immobile for too long.  She smiles and takes off her coat, holding it out to him.  An in the moment of exchange is the return to reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
