dialogues.text: Sleep good. She turns to open the door.  Entering she -- and we -- suddenly can see Neil pacing in the hall, b.g.  He's returned.  He looks up, worried and very upset. CLOSE ANGLES ON FACES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 3 o'clock in the morning. Where the hell have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE heading down a LONG HALL TOWARD GARBER'S OFFICE: It's like running a gauntlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mike, tough night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it happens, you know?  A chick gives you a ride in her limousine, the next thing she wants is to wear your clothes... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I heard he had her underpants on his head. That one got to him; stopped dead by it, he turns, giving KOONTZ a challenging look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ease up, Mike.  Ain't nobody gonna tell the old lady. CLOSE ON MIKE:  cooling down -- then girding himself for GARBER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't the first time the taxpayers paid for a blow-job neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARBER and MIKE on the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steamed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me it was "no big deal," it was out of line, it makes you look like an asshole, and it makes me look like an asshole.  She's coming in, in a few minutes to I.D. Venza.  If Steinhart's with her, I want you to apologize. (in motion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get this over with... In the room next to the corridor, KOONTZ interrupts the shift already there, entering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we're gonna have a line-up here... The OTHER COPS grab their things and scatter, not wanting to get involved in another cop's headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE approaching with NEIL, with T.J. on guard-duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Miss Gregory. MIKE AND CLAIRE catch each other's eyes.  He sees how nervous she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my fault not Detective Keegan's, I'm sorry for all the fuss. NEIL catches MIKE'S glance at her; reassures himself with a glance at CLAIRE, straightens, still steamed from last night. GARBER picks up on it, not liking the tension, especially not now; his eyes throw daggers at MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing the protector role)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will this take long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see. GARBER TURNS, getting them started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crowd in; another MAN already standing there -- VENZA'S PARK AVENUE LAWYER.  A one-way window looks into the brightness of the line-up (squad) room that's emptied now and undergoing preparation by KOONTZ. GARBER to CLAIRE, a professional reassurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't hear you, they can't see you... (introducing pro forma)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Venza's attorney, Mr. Neuman; arresting officer Keegan... (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck. With that, GARBER leads NEIL out.  NEIL manages a final concerned stare at CLAIRE before he goes.  The DOOR CLOSES.  MIKE, CLAIRE, and an unruffled MR. NEUMAN, THE LAWYER, are left alone in the cramped space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KOONTZ beckons VENZA and the OTHER FOUR LINE-UP PARTICIPANTS IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, take a seat... you, put a couple phone books under your rear... VENZA enters confidently, with the others.  He's number three.  He takes his place, staring unconcernedly past th bright lights toward the direction of the mirrored window as if he could see through it, into CLAIRE'S EYES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE, staring expressionless, her eyes etched with fear MIKE aware of that fear.  VENZA'S LAWYER waiting patiently, casually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VENZA and the OTHERS WAITING, now STANDING ON DISPLAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will everyone except number three please take one step back? VENZA'S JAW TIGHTENS, a flicker, before catching himself and controlling the reaction.  Realizing.  She's making positive identification.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE, empty-eyed.  On his way HOME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE dressed for sleep, in a DISNEYWORLD T-SHIRT, pauses to glance with worried eyes -- toward the living room where WE HEAR the SOUND of a TV. ANGLE ON MIKE:  on a couch, beer in hand -- mindlessly watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming to bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Few minutes.  Want to catch the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I wait up?  We've got to get up early for the beach tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right up. She accepts it, reluctantly -- returning to the BEDROOM. CLOSE ON MIKE:  hitting the remote to SCAN the channels; troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE at ease on the couch, staring, trying to follow th images of the television.  NEIL, at the bar, pours them both a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They need me back in Miami, but I'd really like it if you could join me. The marlin fishing's supposed to be great off the Keys... He steps forward with her drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The change would do you a world of good. She straightens, suddenly attentive, in response to something on the TV. It's a REPORT FROM OUTSIDE THE COURTHOUSE, with the TV NEWSMAN reporting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denied bail, Joey Venza will remain behind bars at least until the time of the trial -- ANGLE ON NEIL, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallelujah. He gives her a drink, leaning down to kiss her on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least now we can get on with our own lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where life has indeed returned to normal, except for the heavy weight of memory.  MIKE, at the counter, makes SANDWICHES, packing a cooler for the game.  He grabs TOMM with an arm-hook as TOMMY tries to swipe a sandwich on th pass through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, not yet!  How many times... Roughhousing TOMMY, MIKE gets him squealing.  ELLIE enters, stomping her feet clean, coming in from the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, it's freezin' out there. She blows on her hands, shows MIKE how cold, putting them against his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wincing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! She does it to TOMMY, too, except he's too fast for her, yelling and squirming out of the way.  The PHONE RINGS. ELLIE doesn't answer it.  TOMMY picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a sec. He offers the phone out to ELLIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, just a second. (hands it to Mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Whip. MIKE takes it.  ELLIE turns to TOMMY, who yelps and darts away, avoiding her cold touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Lieutenant, how are you...? What?! (to Ellie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venza's out. (back to phone; pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't the I.D. unit or the D.A.'s office know about his sheet? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah shit... Yeah, yeah, okay I'm on my way in. He SLAMS DOWN THE PHONE, raging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn Venza assaulted a taxi driver in the Bronx, thirteen months ago.  It's coming to court and the judge let him walk because of the pending case law. In a fit of RAGE, he SWIPES at a MILK CARTON, sending it HURTLING AGAINST A WALL.  ANGLE on TOMMY:  amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, take it easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy!  I set her up.  I saw it coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault.  Mike, please get off the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distraught)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is my fault!  I'm responsible for her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I said?!! SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ellie, with finality)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm due on at seven. He dumps the rest of the lunch preparations in the sink, exiting. ANGLE on TOMMY and ELLIE looking distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to the game, are we Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling herself together)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure we are, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC TURNED UP FULL.
dialogues.text: CLAIRE spills red wine over the counter, uncorking the bottle.  She leaves the stain, grabbing the bottle and a wine glass, taking them with her, in emotional extremis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE on MIKE:  as he rounds a corner ALMOST BUMPING INTO the JOGGER from CLAIRE'S BUILDING; MIKE hurries, sidestepping him, HEADING toward the ENTRANCE. ANGLE FROM HIS POV:  CLAIRE'S FRONT ENTRANCE; extra SECURITY -- A SQUAD CAR PARKED IN FRONT now. ANGLE ON MIKE:  SPRINTING INWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ELEVATOR DOORS OPEN and MIKE steps out, breathless, confronting KOONTZ.  The MUSIC CONTINUES TO BLAST from behind the closed apartment doors. KOONTZ grabbing his stuff, massive understatement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a little upset.  You're going to have to piss in a bottle. He holds up a beer bottle; half-filled with urine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (packs it under his arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I don't have any extras. Have a nice night. HE WILLINGLY LEAVE, and MIKE WAITS but a split second, before going to the doors.  They are closed.  MUSIC blare from within.  No other response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distraught, CLAIRE tries to bring herself back from the brink, placing the wine bottle rack down after she's poured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just me.  I want to talk to you.  Let me in... The lock turns and it opens, but just a crack, enough to see that she's hysterical, her eyes reddened from crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put me life in danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you'll be safe.  We're gonna pick him up again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what?  I'll never be safe. I'll have to leave the country!  You can't protect me, and you can't keep him in jail!  And you knew that all the goddamn time! Near bursting, she SLAMS THE DOOR, leaving MIKE STUNNED: Inside, the MUSIC is TURNED UP AGAIN to THUNDEROUS PROPORTIONS. Clenching his fists, MIKE PACES in frustration, then SLAM his fist against the wall -- NOTICING the door has failed to FULLY SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: HE PUSHES IT OPEN, ENTERING THE APARTMENT, CAMERA
dialogues.text: FOLLOWING HIM as he looks for her.  The MUSIC, bounding off the high ceilings and marble floors, is thunderous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching for her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire...? He moves HURRIEDLY DOWN THE HALL to her BEDROOM, entering without warning, to SEE HER REFLECTION in the MIRROR as she PULLS ON SOME CLOTHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? The dress on, she SWEEPS past him, heading toward the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me I'm safe?  I'm going for a walk in the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, will you calm down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm perfectly calm, I'm a normal human being.  I'm going for a walk in the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire...! She heads out the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON CLAIRE:  as she heads down the hall moving fast, he's right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop, will you?! HE GRABS HER, SPINNING HER AROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop being nuts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trusted you!  I thought you cared about me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do care about you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More bullshit!  More bullshit! (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of odds are they giving me?  There must be some kind of office pool.  One month?  A couple of days? Their physicality reaches a CLIMAX with MIKE pinning her against the wall, she, restrained by him, finally GIVING UP, with a SOB, and COLLAPSING INTO HIS ARMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handling her close)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy... easy... I'm not gonna leave you alone like this... ANGLE ON CLAIRE:  gasping as she clings to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna let anything happen to you... He holds her; makes a tentative move toward her -- and stops.  She CLOSES THE DISTANCE.  THEY KISS.  They separate, making sure.  They KISS AGAIN, certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE startles awake, premonitorily. ELLIE:  She turns in the darkness to look at the clock. Heart beating, she reclines again, lying awake, realizing what it was that woke her.  She listens, hearing it again A shuffling SOUND, something moving, outside. She stirs, sitting up, listening. ANGLE:  Only silence answers. ELLIE gets up, dissatisfied by the silence, and moves to the rear bedroom window. AT THE REAR WINDOW, she looks out into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BACK YARD
dialogues.text: It's almost impossible to see anything.  Nothing moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE closes TOMMY'S door, listens again for the SOUND; starts quietly down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE reaches the ground floor, moving for the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE enters.  She GASPS.  A SMALL SHADOWED FIGURE TURNS, CONFRONTING HER.  It's TOMMY, having left his room earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's somebody outside... Recovering from the scare, ELLIE grabs him, relieved, sinking to her KNEES and HOLDING HIM TIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE gets up, dressing.  CLAIRE watches from the bed.  He returns her gaze, reluctant to go, but hesitating to touc her again.  CLAIRE clasps his hand, bringing him closer. They kiss, in affirmation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE stands by the front door as T.J. arrives to begin his duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna need snow boots. MIKE nods, absently, entering the elevator.  The PHONE starts to RING in the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE; miserable.  The "QUEENS" exit is SEEN APPROACHING through the TRAIN WINDOW; he attempts to pull himself together, rising, waiting for the train to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As MIKE rounds the corner and looks up.  His breath catches.  His heart starts to pound. AHEAD, lights ablaze.  ONE COP CAR is in front of his HOUSE, and a JEEP (Belonging to SCOTTY).  MIKE BREAKS INT A RUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes in.  The front door is unlocked, lights are on, but otherwise there is nothing different.  He hears VOICES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE hurries in.  The room is bright.  SCOTTY and another cop, BROOKLYN from the 117th, look up from the kitchen table, nursing cups of coffee.  BROOKLYN is on duty; SCOTTY has come over on his own. TOMMY has long since been ushered back to bed.  ELLIE making coffee at the stove, turns as MIKE enters. She is okay, returning MIKE'S stare with embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, everything is okay. Ellie reported a prowler.  Probably one of those peepers who've been making this neighborhood such a pleasure... SCOTTY collects his gun from the table, rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all look like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there you are... (to Ellie, unconcerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come 'round in the car from time to time so you can get some sleep.  Just keep the shades pulled. He gives her a peck, yawning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to both)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  You're terrific. SCOTTY waves her off with a goodbye, exiting after BROOKLYN.  ELLIE turns back to MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepishly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I know I heard noises... the detective's wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tensely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you and Tommy to stay with my mother. She shakes her head, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous... That's all I need, rubbing up against your mother and grandmother every day... I can take care of myself... (gently, to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's go to bed... we all need some sleep... CLOSE ON MIKE.  Feeling like absolute hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE is threading his necktie.  ELLIE stands behind him, in the kitchen, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, don't make an issue of it. Do you want the fucking meatloaf or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'you have to say "fucking" every other word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Mike, somebody's been feeding you a line of crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about I've been talking this way for sixteen years and now, out of the blue, it's vulgar! She leaves the room, slamming the door behind her.  He looks at himself in the mirror, wondering what's possesse him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.  What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE sits at the table with a cup of coffee.  He watches ELLIE from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE:  Tight jeans, workshirt, scarf tied around her head, she looks great.  She looks up, rinsing a greasy grill over a bucket of hot water, playfully sprays the window with the hose, seeing him watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE walking along the platform amidst the crowded car, returning to his work and his destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy silence.  MIKE sitting, on duty again.  He keeps to himself.  He doesn't move from his chair. CLAIRE finally enters.  She holds tensely, waiting, aware of his mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything all right? His stare is unyielding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They called here after you left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's okay.  Everything's okay... He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anguished)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is me, Mike.  There's nothing else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't wash your clothes at the Boulevard Laundromat... you don't pick up your kids from some crummy public school... what is this?  A fuckin' joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; sustaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then let's make it easy.  It was a mistake.  Don't make me feel guilty now that it's over, let's forget about it. She walks away; MIKE sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to her table to resume work.  Scribbled pages litter the surface.  Her hands betray her.  It's an effor of will.  MIKE enters, moving closer. Beginning to cry, she feels his embrace, turning into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think I know what this is doing.  I know you have a wife.  I know you have a family... I'm not asking for anything.  I don't want anything... Just please hold me I'm scared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE lies asleep.  MIKE leans over her as she wakes, meeting his gaze, bringing him closer before he goes. They kiss.  He withdraws, tenderly returning her gaze and returning her to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. standing in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike...? ANGLE ON T.J., as the bedroom DOOR OPENS -- REVEALING MIKE.  T.J. recoils with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man.  I don't believe you. MIKE steps out, closing the door behind him; distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All fucked up, T.J. T.J. issues a long, saddened sigh; just staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE sits in a chair by the far wall, staring out toward Manhattan, which glows palely, in the distance.  Now PAN OVER THE BED where ELLIE lies asleep.  But as WE MOVE CLOSE TO HER FACE, WE SEE she is not asleep; wide-eyed, aware of MIKE in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE stirs as MIKE slips between the sheets.  She embraces him, starts to kiss him.  He rolls over. A moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta get another tour.  We're gettin' too old for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying it's your fault. More silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember Michael, go to sleep.  You don't have to make conversation with me. She snuggles up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make a reservation tomorrow for early dinner.  You can sleep till noon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LIGHTS of New York beginning to sparkle against a darkening sky; MIKE and ELLIE at a table that looks out o the East River.  It's an OK restaurant, not the poshest i the world.  ELLIE finds herself carrying most of the conversation.  They scan menus to order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we qualify for the Senior Citizens Early-Bird Special... Did you see Tommy today?  He misses you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  This'll be over soon. Venza's such a nut job, we're bound to pick him up soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you to switch to the day shift, Mike.  To be home for dinner. Helen insists that T.J. be home for dinner... That's why he's on the morning shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, T.J.'s... seniority... and all. (evasive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to Garber about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (girds herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already did.  I mean, I talked to his wife, and she talked to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopped)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talked to his wife? CLOSE ON MIKE:  incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife talks to his wife about what shift I'm gonna take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference? MIKE is nonplused; not knowing how to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless there's some particular reason why it feels better to be around her at night. He shakes his head, dismissively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there, Mike? No response; MIKE having trouble with it. CLOSE ON ELLIE:  sensing deception.  Her eyes begin to glisten. CLOSE ON MIKE:  seeing her distress.  Unable to hide his own. She looks at him -- and knowing him as well as she does, is certain.  She puts a hand in front of her mouth in an attempt not to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, what is it?  Is it serious or what...?  Quit looking at me like that!  What's with this ridiculous silence?! Her eyes flush with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn.  I never thought this would happen to me... you fuckin' sonofabitch... She UPSETS her SETTING, GETTING UP from the TABLE, shakin him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you off the case.  Get off it, or don't come home. (her voice trembling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I want you to remember... when we're old... that when this awful thing happened... I behaved like a lady. (embittered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kind of "lady" you apparently prefer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got some specials. She BOLTS from the room; MIKE following her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the waiter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She weaves toward the car.  MIKE goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me drive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me... get away!  She means that much to you, you stay with her.  But you come back, you come back for me.  Not for Tommy, not for your mother, or your fucking job, but for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tortured)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El?  I'm sorry.  I do love you. (with difficulty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are a lady.  I have so much respect... She TURNS and SWINGS AT HIM, catching him SQUARE IN THE NOSE; he's stunned and bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through her tears; screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucker!  Don't tell me how much respect you have!  You dumb mother fucking FUCKER!  Now get off this case or don't come home!! She RUNS to her car, BURNING RUBBER as she PEELS out of the PARKING LOT -- leaving MIKE, distraught, gazing after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRAFFIC ROARING BY -- revealing MIKE, upset, on a pay phone, a finger in one ear, waiting for the phone to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, T.J.?  Yeah, listen, I need a huge favor from you, man.  I know Helen doesn't like you to miss dinner, but I need you to switch shifts with me tonight. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just "personal".  I don't know what the hell I'm doin', I need some time to think. (angered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, do it or don't do it, but spare me the fuckin' lecture, all right? He HANGS UP:  miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SQUAD CAR parked in front, CAMERA PANNING to the DOORS, as the JOGGER (MR. SPARKS) EXITS, dressed in his usual outfit, POUNDING DETERMINEDLY across the street. ANOTHER ANGLE:  as he LOPES INTO THE PARK. ANOTHER ANGLE:  as he REACHES a STOPLIGHT CROSSING that's "RED"; he waits to cross, jogging in place; crosses into the park.  A sinister lone black LIMO approaches, slowing to a stop behind him, its back door slowly swinging open, engulfing our sight of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "JOGGER" returning, obscuring his identity from the parked PATROL CAR, by wiping his face with a towel. Before heading to the door, where a DOORMAN stands guard, he delays as though WAITING FOR SOMETHING. It's happening:  A dainty teenage VIETNAMESE GIRL, distracts the DOORMAN at his post, getting enough of his attention SELLING FLOWERS, and SPOUTING VIETNAMESE, for the "JOGGER" to SLIP BY, making it inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know sweetheart... we have enough flowers here. ANGLE:  VIETNAMESE GIRL, still spouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, sweetheart... not here... get going... Okay. ANGLE: VIETNAMESE GIRL, backing off, seeing the JOGGER slip by and her mission accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly, to Doorman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice day. THE GIRL:  slyly cursing the DOORMAN in Vietnamese as she skips off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "JOGGER," his face still obscured by the towel waits for the elevator, as T.J., arriving, ENTERS the building. They both enter the elevator in silence. ANGLE on T.J. glancing at the JOGGER quizzically.  The JOGGER avoids his stare, CAMERA TILTING UP to the indicator, beginning to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON "JOGGER'S" key, entering the LOCK.  IT TURNS. CLOSE ON HIS FACE.  He ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the killer closes the door.  He's in the kitchen.  All is quiet in there. IN CLOSEUPS, WE SEE his JOGGING SHIRT coming off, revealing a shoulder holster; a specially designed "belt" removed and laid on the kitchen table.  A "SILENCER" within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE eagerly and earnestly preparing dinner.  She makes some fluffs, not really used to this.  CLASSICAL MUSIC plays.  She looks up expectantly, hearing the FOOTSTEPS. CLOSE ON CLAIRE:  surprised to see it's T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Keegan is... Mike... "Michael" asked me to tell you he's under the weather. CLAIRE:  She handles it, crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll probably take the morning shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's okay? T.J. spots, over his shoulder, the table, set for two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just... bad gut.  Y'know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Nothing left to say; she hides her disappointment with a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Active with nightlife; CAMERA PANNING to a lone figure walking in the night.  It's MIKE; his collar turned up against the cold, his face grim and pensive.  He passes a art gallery and PAUSES to gaze in, his eyes refocusing on his own reflection staring back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE immobile, on a window seat in her LIVING ROOM, the CLASSICAL MUSIC still playing softly in the background, her eyes empty as she gazes out into the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside and far below, the GLOW from the tip of a CIGARETTE REDDENS the darkness with an inhalation. VENZA:  He stands, impervious to the cold, looking up at the windows of CLAIRE'S apartment. ANGLE UP TO CLAIRE:  SILHOUETTED in the distant window. VENZA:  finishes his butt, flicks it, satisfied, getting into HIS CAR curbside and driving away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J., DOZING as the ELEVATOR INDICATOR HEADS UPWARD -- finally reaching our FLOOR. The DOORS OPEN, STARTLING T.J.  He stares at MIKE with DISMAY.  MUSIC IS HEARD from just inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fatigued)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me I'm dreamin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just gotta talk to her, T.J. MIKE ENTERS, closing the doors behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent, save for CLASSICAL MUSIC -- as MIKE quietly enters. He pauses a moment, his eyes filled with unhappiness, the MOVES in the direction of the MUSIC -- SPOTTING CLAIRE, immobile since we last saw her, still gazing out the window. CLOSE ON MIKE:  as always, AFFECTED BY HER. She becomes aware of his presence and slowly TURNS.  For long moment, neither seems willing to move -- or speak. Finally, he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. agreed to take my shift.  He knows about us. She absorbs it, without response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat; with difficulty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So does Ellie. She nods.  Thoughtfully.  As though willing to deal with it intellectually, but avoiding any encounter with her emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Her eyes turn to his.  She moves toward him and sits. CLAIRE pulls him close to her.  A soft GERSHWIN TUNE plays.  She sees how drawn MIKE is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're tired. (smiles, gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me watch over you tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet.  MIKE sleeps deeply on the bed.  CLAIRE does her work at the bedroom desk nearby; glances gently over, keeping her watch, glad of the feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MERV GRIFFIN SHOW playing on the TV; it ends, a VOICE OVER indicating to "stay tuned for the news".  It is SILENCED by remote control -- we HEAR FOOTSTEPS moving away. ANGLE INSIDE THE KITCHEN:  CLOSE on the murderous paraphernalia left on the kitchen table, being assembled by the "JOGGER".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment pin-quiet and darkened.  T.J. in his chair -- head arched back; snoring; his self-help book abandone on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPARKS' FRONT DOOR quietly "CLICKING" SHUT as the KILLER EXITS. CLOSER ANGLE:  THE BUTTON of the ELEVATOR being PUSHED by a GLOVED HAND.  It activates a "HUM."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG ANGLE down the HALL, on the CLOSED DOOR TO THE BEDROOM SUITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ELEVATOR slides to a stop, its DOOR GLIDING OPEN. THE KILLER, keeping himself flattened back out of sight, glances quickly out, gun and reflexes at the ready. It's unnecessary.  The vestibule's deserted; T.J.'S post is momentarily empty. The KILLER steps silently, EASING out the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. at the TOILET; yawning as he pees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KILLER pauses, hearing the TOILET FLUSH, retreats the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As T.J. emerges from the bathroom.  He stretches, trying to shake his fatigue.  Making a decision, he HEADS for th KITCHEN to get a cup of coffee -- CAMERA FOLLOWING HIM as he ENTERS, snapping on the light. MOVING directly to the stove, he examines the Mr. Coffee; the red "ON" button glows, but the pot is virtually empty Picking it up, he MOVES TO THE SINK, turning on the tap, which is a thin, gooseneck spigot.  He look up, hearing a slight SHUFFLE, seeing the KILLER'S FEET sticking out of the shadows of the floor of the LAUNDRY ROOM. T.J. reacts -- TOO LATE -- there's a slight chung, and a hole opens up in T.J.'S gut; the bullet that went through him, ricocheting and nicking off the end of the thin, curving tap, sending a stream of water gushing straight up. The KILLER moves quickly, catching T.J.'S body, trying to break its fall as it hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE asleep in MIKE'S PROTECTIVE EMBRACE:  MIKE, awake, his eyes to the bedside table, notices the almost imperceptible disturbance of VIBRATION ripple the surface of the DRINK left there by the clock. MIKE sits up; as if by instinct, sensing something is wrong.  CLAIRE continues to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KILLER OPENS THE BEDROOM SUITE DOOR, steps into the ANTEROOM.  Off to the right is the closed DOOR of the BEDROOM.  He steps in the direction, reaching the doorkno -- thinks twice about it, though, seeing the door on the other side of the anteroom which would take him the longer, but unexpected route into the bedroom.  He backs off, moving silently to the OTHER DOOR, turning it open silently and slipping through into the CLOSET and WALK- THROUGH DRESSING ROOM leading to the bedroom by the far side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE:  on the other side of the door, listening. He opens the door quietly, sees the anteroom door ajar, remembering that he had closed it before.  He tightens, closing the door and moving back to his gun in its holste draped over the chair with his other clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KILLER enters the reflective maze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE moves silently, backtracking through the bedroom and bathroom toward the DOORS leading to the dressing room ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KILLER passes the door he wants, thinking it's just another mirror; finds himself in the totally MIRRORED ENVIRONMENT of the MAIN DRESSING AREA. On the other side of the door, MIKE HEARS HIM, tightening his grip on his gun and on the doorknob as he REACHES for it.  MIKE grasps it, turning and opening the door silently.  But the latch connects to the light, and the LIGHT GOES ON OVERHEAD of MIKE. The KILLER reacts quickly, gun drawn, on the turn.  But h faces SEVERAL REFLECTIONS OF MIKE in front of him -- and MIKE IS BEHIND HIM. MIKE LEVELS AIM AT HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it down! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it! The KILLER takes his chances, WHIRLING.  MIKE FIRES FIRST NAILING HIM right through the HEAD.  The KILLER SPINS AGAIN, SLAMMING UP against the MIRRORS and falling DEAD t the floor. IN THE BEDROOM:  CLAIRE wakes. MIKE:  checking quickly on the dead assassin, flattens himself against the wall and scurries back through the bath the way back into the BEDROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (entering, to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the floor!  There may be more! CLAIRE does what he says. MIKE RACES into the CORRIDOR, hugging the wall; he PAUSES momentarily, then RACES down the HALL. ANGLE ON THE OPENED FRONT DOOR as he REACHES IT, seeing T.J.'S CHAIR empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate)

dialogues.speaker: T.J.
dialogues.text: MIKE RUNS, frantically, into the living room, the bathroom, the den -- CAMERA FOLLOWING HIM into the KITCHEN. CLOSE ON HIS FACE:  twisting with GRIEF. ANGLE ON T.J. face down in a pool of blood, MIKE RACING TO HIM, rolling him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobs)

dialogues.speaker: T.J...
dialogues.text: MIKE moves by REFLEX, starting mouth-to-mouth.  But there is blood everywhere. MIKE desperate; pumping T.J.'S chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live, T.J.  Please...! CLAIRE appears behind him, to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get security on the phone! Emergency! She RUNS to the KITCHEN PHONE; it's dead, the WIRES CUT. She TURNS, HURRYING to the VESTIBULE and THE ELEVATOR, pulling the alarm, sagging in collapse.  The ALARM goes off within the shaft, THROUGHOUT the building. ANGLE ON MIKE:  shirtless and shoeless, on his knees in T.J.'S blood, desperately pumping his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his voice cracking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambulance!  Ambulance!  He's got a heartbeat...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE alone on a bench, his head in his hands:  a couple o COPS we recognize from the Precinct stand a distance away at a coffee machine, talking softly as they glance at him It is not yet dawn. FOOTSTEPS are HEARD coming TOWARD; MIKE looks up to see GARBER APPROACHING, his expression appropriate to the occasion.  GARBER reaches him; they exchange a long look, MIKE'S eyes etched with anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're operating on him.  He's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard. A long pause, as he looks at MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard a lot... Anything you want to deny, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost inaudibly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should've been me... GARBER:  aware of his own dilemma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it would've been her, too. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... but I gotta protect the Precinct, too.  You're on suspension, pending Disciplinary Hearings.  Don't hold your breath. And you're not to go near that woman until she's no longer under Police protection and this case is closed. ANGLE ON MIKE:  responding with a silent nod as GARBER stands looking down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it "love," Mike?  I hope so.  I want it to be worth it, for your sake. No response. In the response that follows, they HEAR MOVEMENT at the end of the HALL, looking up to see the silhouetted figure of ELLIE, with HELEN GREENING in tow.  They look small, and lost, framed against a floor-to-ceiling window that's beginning to illuminate with the first light of day. Heavy with sadness, GARBER turns and heads toward the women.  Taking a long moment.  MIKE decides not to follow

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: CAMERA STAYS AT THIS DISTANCE as the THREESOME comes together.  We do not hear their words, but sense the emotion by what WE SEE.  After a brief exchange of words, GARBER takes HELEN GREENING under his arm, and they MOVE AWAY -- leaving MIKE and ELLIE alone. CLOSER ANGLE:  MIKE and ELLIE, gazing at each other acros the gulf of their collective misery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to visit my sister for a few days.  I'd like you to get your stuff out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Tommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll live through it.  They all live through it. (bitter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a world, huh? Nothing left to say; after a long, last look, she turns t go.  But stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it Venza?  Did you get him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The last thing she's going to do is cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her voice giving out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a shame. She TURNS and LEAVES:  MIKE gazing after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE is being shown in by SCOTTY, luggage in hand, SCOTTY doing his best to be a good "host," under trying circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see a couple of the parties that go on at this place, you'll realize that marriage is an institution whose time has come and gone. Opening a bedroom door.  They've entered a bedroom that's sparse, but decorated with A BOY'S PARAPHERNALIA; skateboard, "rock" posters, etc.  It looks sad and barren

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Scotty stays on Wednesdays, and every other weekend.  And know what?  Our relationship's never been better. MIKE stares at the room, his heart too heavy to respond. SCOTTY, with a pat on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it home, Mike... He leaves -- and after a long moment MIKE sits on the edg of the bed, like an automaton.  Staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE and NEIL in the aftermath.  CLAIRE remains silent, staring.  Whatever is to be said is his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no saint, Claire, but I do love you.  I can understand the pressure of the circumstances... but what about when it's over?  Are you going to feel the same way about him?  Is he going to move in here and do shift work at the 21st if they'll have him back.  Think this through Claire. (with feeling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the rest of your life we're talking about. NEIL staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have thought it through, Neil. He adverts his gaze, turns, controlling himself, and pick up his coat to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me if anything changes.  I love you, Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KOONTZ and a uniformed COP on guard duty. KOONTZ scanning The Post, which has a front page article on it with a headline that indicates the whole story has not "quite" been told:  "INTRUDER SLAIN IN DARING EAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable, man, the fuckin' jogger... they found him in Atlantic City, totally drugged out and still jogging... The APARTMENT DOOR SWINGS OPEN and NEIL EMERGES.  KOONTZ and the COP look up, straightening.  KOONTZ folds away th paper.  But NEIL hardly even acknowledges or notices them EXITING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGING -- CAMERA FINDING CLAIRE, looking like ghost of her past self -- REACHING FOR THE PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike.  Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE on the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I do want to know.  I tried to reach you at the precinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've moved into Scotty's... Good news about T.J., though.  Looks like that tough son of a gun is gonna pull through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, that's great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to brighten)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm fine.  They've replaced you with quite an entourage.  It's a regular "marching band".  You should see me on the street, you'd think I was the First Lady -- She attempts a laugh, trying to keep it "light".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking them all out to Queens, as a matter of fact, right in your neighborhood.  There's an event at my Father's school... an anniversary... I thought maybe you could come...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that thing in Queens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faltering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going away after that, the next morning.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Impacted by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty far.  I'm told not to say anything about it on the phone, in case it's tapped... they think it's best, safer, if I go away, at least till Venza's found. CLOSE ONE MIKE:  absorbing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When can I see you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Garber's left orders here not to let you in the building.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MIKE:  beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.  When is it?  This thing in Queens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night.  Can you come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (torn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  It wouldn't be very smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you're right.  Don't do it. I'll just... send you an address, okay? Fighting tears; not wanting him to know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No really, it's okay, I've gotta go. I'm expecting some calls.  I'll be fine, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll think about Wednesday. MIKE hangs up, torn.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANNING TO REVEAL MIKE, leaning on a CAR, under th "El" waiting.  HE SPOTS TOMMY, coming around the corner with his SKATEBOARD under his arm, going into a grocery store.  MIKE crosses the street as TOMMY comes out of the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy! TOMMY SPOTS HIM:  hesitant -- slowly approaching the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are things going, pal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about dinner tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evasive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom and I got plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What "plans?"  You and Mom got "plans?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's taking singing lessons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She met some friend of Aunt Millie's who works for a record company.  He thinks she's got a great voice. TOMMY is mum:  something dawns on MIKE that sobers him up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outraged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!  What kind of pathetic line is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna pass the street. MIKE stops.  His goat is gotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coming in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not coming in.  And if you'd rather go to a "singing lesson" than have dinner with your father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to a singing lesson, she's just gonna start taking singing lessons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what are you doing tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  She says we gotta get used to being alone in this neighborhood. (a long beat; observing his father)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bye, Dad. TOMMY starts toward the HOUSE.  He's emotional, but doesn't know how to express it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy! (a parting shot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's a sleaze-bag.  She can't sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back, smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think she can sing, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care, pal. HE TURNS AWAY. ANOTHER ANGLE:  MIKE'S CAR LEAVING.  TOMMY watches it until it can be seen no longer, then TURNS, going into th house. CAMERA PANS SLOWLY -- REVEALING, far down the BLOCK, a CAR.  VENZA, and ANOTHER MAN (SOSA), are within: WATCHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE pounds it out running on the darkened street.  He pauses to look up at his dark, empty house as a PATROL CA slows to check him out.  He studies them as they pass. CLOSE ON MIKE:  he gazes after them, then continues to jog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUN BLASTS going off in OUR EARS, CAMERA PANNING A LINE o COPS putting in their PRACTICE HOURS; ENDING ON ELLIE, he EAR BLOCKERS on, FIRING AWAY. CLOSE ON TOMMY watching from a booth behind her. ANGLE ON HER TARGET.  Its balls blasted off. She comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you supposed to aim at the head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE in the driver's seat, TOMMY in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, what's going to happen with you and Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know Tommy. A LONG BEAT as TOMMY thinks about this.  His attention switches to a passing McDONALD'S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can we go to McDonald's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overhead, chandeliers gleam.  A small orchestra comprised of STUDENTS of the school plays a variety of tunes. Mirrors reflect a profusion of flowers, carved gilt and candlelight. Gloved service PERSONNEL wait to be of service at the sides.  The room is quite large yet intimate.  The tables set perfectly.  GUESTS continue to move toward their places engaged in animated chatter. ANOTHER ANGLE:  CLAIRE moving through the crowd, PLAINCLOTHESMEN flanking her as anonymously as possible (KOONTZ among them), HER EYES anxious, scanning the crowd SHE'S SPOTTED by the PRINCIPAL of the school (GIDDINGS), who APPROACHES, surprised to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Claire.  How extraordinary that you came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was something my father always liked me to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apprehensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're planning to speak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you don't want me to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a brief hesitation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course, we'd be... honored...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understands; gamely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just putting in an appearance then. SHE GLANCES around, her "ESCORTS" mistaking it for anxiety, one of them taking her arm and escorting her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPEECHES droning on -- CAMERA FINDING CLAIRE at a round dinner table, with OTHERS, who think they're engaging her in conversation; but her thoughts are elsewhere, her eyes continually glancing toward the doors -- both hoping and fearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SPEECHES have long since ENDED, PEOPLE DANCING, slow dances to the live orchestra -- CAMERA PANNING to CLAIRE, sitting in silent isolation at the now sparsely populated table, having lost hope, feeling utterly alone.  Her chin is resting in her hand, her eyes fixed sadly on her wine glass.  PLAINCLOTHESMEN, situated around her, study her dispassionately. CLOSE ON HER FACE:  expressionless.  But it slowly gains animation, as she realizes the MUSIC has changed, made a segue to something new.  It's "SOMEONE TO WATCH OVER ME." SHE LOOKS UP -- to see MIKE; his approach from the bandstand indicating that the change of music was his doing. HER FACE breaks into the most enormous, and grateful, GRIN. CLOSE ON MIKE:  returning the smile as he COMES TOWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he passes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, man.  I love ya, but you're out of your mind. Uncaring, MIKE MOVES TO CLAIRE. ANGLE ON BOTH:  gazing at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overwhelmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it. They TAKE to the FLOOR, she MOVING INTO HIS ARMS.  She puts her head on his shoulder, then draws back to look at him, studying his face with the hunger of a woman who knows it might be for the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They guys treatin' you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too emotional to really talk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been doing a lot of thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. CLOSE ON HIM:  studying her saddened eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. The conversation is deeply caring; the tone opposite to the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd miss my life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Don't explain. She rests her head on his shoulders again; they continue to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you going away for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To"... Forget about you. CLOSE ON HER:  awash in the nearness of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to pack a lot of clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choked up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... He holds her tight -- his eyes EMOTIONAL as they roam the room -- But HIS EXPRESSION CHANGES as he SPOTS SOMETHING at a far end of the room.  Near the rear doors. It's a PLAINCLOTHESMEN, headed purposefully toward KOONTZ conferring with him -- both men looking to MIKE, a sense of bewilderment in their eyes. ANGLE ON MIKE:  Stopping -- as KOONTZ heads quickly toward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brook's patching a call through to you.  He thought he'd find you here. It sounds urgent. MIKE:  Baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says it's your son. Exchanging a quick LOOK with CLAIRE, MIKE heads for the DOORS; she pauses, heading after.

dialogues.speaker: OUTER LOBBY
dialogues.text: as MIKE BARRELS through doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office down the hall. MIKE BREAKS INTO A RUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as MIKE RACES IN; A PLAINCLOTHESMAN hands him the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy?  What...? (frightened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  Hello? (listening; stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this? (trying to be calm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I'm listening. (quick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Nobody but me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the RECEIVER of the PHONE:  as JOEY VENZA'S mout SPEAKS into it -- The images of ELLIE and TOMMY SEEN, dimly lit, in the background, petrified; GUARDED by a SECOND MAN (SOSA) whose figure is shrouded in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you're where I expected you to be, Detective Keegan, 'cause you're got two minutes to get home or I take your family out.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: caught in a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you.  I'll do it.  Just don't touch them. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: I...
dialogues.text: (a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme talk to my son. (suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? It goes dead.  MIKE PARALYZED with FEAR.  CLAIRE is ENTERING, PLAINCLOTHESMAN #1 close to her heels, MIKE'S breath coming in SHUDDERS as he stares helplessly at her -- then turns to the PLAINCLOTHESMAN and KOONTZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got my family. (to Koontz)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venza. OTHER PLAINCLOTHESMEN are COMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At my house...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call a cruiser!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Venza.  He wants you.  You, for Ellie and Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. (to others; urgent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're takin' her home! (swinging into crisis mode)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it!  Get the cars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koontz!  I need you guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll call SWAT.  We'll get the locals. (re: another cops's radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I need'm now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Koontz)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My job is to protect you! (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Koontz --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near hysteria)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No One-Seventeen, they'll fuck it up!  He told me not to tell anybody, to bring Claire and come alone!  He won't wait, he knows I'm two minutes away!  Koontz, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it, you know that... He's not gonna allow it anyway, Mike.  No way is he gonna let anybody walk out of that house alive, who can finger him. MIKE WHIRLS, heedlessly, running for the DOORS, CLAIRE RACING AFTER HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike!  Don't go there...!  Then make them come with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't, they're assigned to you!  I'd do the same thing! He RACES OUT THE DOOR:  she in PURSUIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get her. PLAINCLOTHESMAN #1 hurries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reconsidering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it, man.  Our brother needs us. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE BOUNDING to his car, CLAIRE hot on his heels.  She JUMPS into the PASSENGER SEAT, pounding the DOOR LOCK SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!  Get outta here! PLAINCLOTHESMAN #1 REACHES HER, pulling on the DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're assigned to me, they'll have to go if I come with you! MIKE HESITATES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not getting out!  GO! MIKE hits the ACCELERATOR -- PEELING OUT, leaving PLAINCLOTHESMAN #1 stranded on the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to him, emerging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adams...!  C'mon, move it! ANGLE ON COPS:  RACING FOR THEIR CARS -- SCREECHING OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE'S CAR tearing down the STREET -- PURSUED by TWO MORE SQUAD CARS, one of them not knowing better, GIVING VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE'S terrified eyes glancing into the REARVIEW MIRROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn off the siren...! Luckily, THEY DO. CLOSE ON CLAIRE:  wide-eyed.  In silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get there, you get down, stay out of sight.  Don't get near that house.  Understand me?  Venza's not to know you're there! She NODS:  terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As MIKE'S CAR COMES TO A SCREECHING HALT, MIKE RUNNING OU as CLAIRE DUCKS DOWN.  The house is COMPLETELY DARKENED, blending in with the night; the PURSUIT CARS CONVERGE as MIKE makes it to the DOOR, his HANDS TREMBLING as he FUMBLES with his KEYS... takes a deep breath... and ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkened and pin-drop silent.  They only thing that can b heard is the SOUND of CAR DOORS slamming outside, as COPS run into combat positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy?  Ellie...? The SOUND of a MUFFLED WHIMPER comes from the kitchen; he HEADS TOWARD down a narrow HALLWAY.  He falters, ALMOST STEPPING on a SKATEBOARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not armed!  I'm the only one in here!  I can help you get away if you listen to what I say! He's used to the SOUND OF HIS VOICE to mask the slight "roll" of the SKATEBOARD under his foot:  He's sliding it into the middle of the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm comin' in the kitchen!  If you fuckin' shoot me, they'll come in here, and we're all dead!  You hear me, Venza?! No answer -- MIKE continues on, girding himself as he steps into the KITCHEN DOORWAY.  He tries the light- switch; it doesn't work.  And then a VOICE SPEAKS.  Its breath, like his, is labored; the VOICE CRACKLING with tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made a terrible mistake, Keegan. You didn't do what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his voice shaking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, you're gonna do what I say. (desperate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey.  I want to help you out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should'a brought the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought the girl.  She's outside. He MOVES to the WINDOW; it's right BESIDE THE TABLE. VENZA TENSING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll prove it! He LIFTS THE WINDOW, CALLING OUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE, having shouted from behind a COP CAR:  KOONTZ grabbing hold of her to keep her in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a hiss of warning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not another word until I tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VENZA; wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know that's her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bring her in.  You let them go, and I'll bring her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should she come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She trusts me.  She'll do what I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit!  Prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koontz!  Let her come in!  Claire! It's pitch dark in here! (his words are carefully chosen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna have trouble seeing anything, so just come in, and straight down a long hall.  Then stand at the door so we can see you. We want to see your face and we won't be able to until you get to the kitchen door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KOONTZ receiving his "message".  Quickly assessing CLAIRE he looks to the COPS around him -- then GRITS HIS TEETH with DECISION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want your guarantee they'll be turned loose when she opens the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get my hostage first.  No one's turned loose until I say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let my kid go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not lettin' no one go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that gun away from his head, or I'll keep her from coming in!  Put the gun on me, he can't hurt you! He's tied up!  Put him under the table!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you fuckin' give orders to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him under the table or I'll stop her from coming in. MIKE turns to the window, about to shout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tommy, an order)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take his place, all right?  Put the gun to my head. MIKE YANKS TOMMY under the TABLE, taking HIS PLACE in THE CHAIR; the COCKED GUN presses up against MIKE'S TEMPLE. ANGLE ON ELLIE:  Her widened eyes continuing to INDICATE "beneath the table". CLOSE ON TOMMY, ON HIS KNEES, his hands tied behind his back; emitting a whimper of terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful, Tommy. HE LOOKS UP:  SPOTTING HER GUN, where she'd hidden it for safe-keeping, TAPED SECURELY, just OVER HIS HEAD. The FRONT DOOR OPENS -- with a SLOW CREAK -- the FIGURE O CLAIRE, her dress silhouetted by the moonlight from outside, SEEN standing in the front hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire!  It's dark.  Watch your step.  Come slowly. ANGLE ON TOMMY:  trying desperately to get his hands, tie behind his back, within reach of the GUN taped over his head.  It's impossible. CLOSE ON MIKE:  eyes darting to ELLIE -- as the FIGURE slowly APPROACHES down the DARKENED HALL, his HAND lowering beneath his knees, within reach of TOMMY, under the TABLE. ANGLE ON TOMMY:  in a near HEADSTAND, his small hands managing to TOUCH THE TAPE, his fingernails futilely attempting to DIG BENEATH IT -- as the FOOTSTEPS continue to APPROACH down the DARKENED HALL. ANGLE ON THE FIGURE:  almost at the kitchen door -- about to STEP INTO THE LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your step!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you doin'?! TOMMY'S HANDS are on the GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a skateboard in the door! With a sudden SOUND of TAPE "RIPPING" from under the

dialogues.speaker: TABLE. ALL HELL BREAKS LOOSE. TOMMY ROLLS, THRUSTING TH
dialogues.text: GUN INTO MIKE'S HAND as the FIGURE at the DOOR KICKS THE SKATEBOARD, sending it ZOOMING INTO THE ROOM.  VENZA LEAP ASIDE AND FIRES, the FIGURE at the DOOR OPENING FIRE in RETURN.  MIKE LEAPS FOR ELLIE, knocking her off her CHAIR rolling FAST as the ENTIRE KITCHEN ERUPTS IN GUNFIRE. ANGLE ON ELLIE:  throwing herself OVER TOMMY, BULLETS "PINGING" AROUND MIKE as he ROLLS, RETURNING THE FIRE. The pitch-black kitchen shudders with BANGS and FLASHES like the Fourth of July, mixed with the "WHINE" of bullet hitting pots and pans, and the sight of BODIES hurtling through the dark. The "FIGURE AT THE DOOR" is firing with both hands, SCORING A HIT ON VENZA'S ACCOMPLICE, who goes down, wounded, HIS GUN CLATTERING to the FLOOR.  He REACHES for it, but ELLIE GETS THERE FIRST, grabbing it with her two hands tied in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tommy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down! The ACCOMPLICE is staggering upward as ELLIE gets to her feet, SQUARING OFF in POLICE STANCE -- and FIRES, catchin him square between the SHOULDER BLADES; HE SPINS, crashin BACKWARDS through the GLASS DOOR -- SWISH-PAN to VENZA, trying to get out THE KITCHEN WINDOW...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around, fuck! He DOES, BLASTED by MIKE, and the "FIGURE" in the door, SIMULTANEOUSLY.  He falls out the window, but still has life in him, staggering to his feet, and hit by SPOTLIGHT from the CARS OUTSIDE.  In a sudden barrage, he's hit by CROSSFIRE, SPINNING, LURCHING -- finally going down. And then all is quiet. INSIDE THE KITCHEN -- all sound and movement has suddenly ceased; everyone is a state of shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all right. The overhead LIGHT is SNAPPED ON by the "FIGURE" in the doorway -- revealing it to be KOONTZ.  In CLAIRE'S DRESS. Guns in both hands, still smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphatic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' miracle, man. In the BACKGROUND distant SIRENS are HEARD heading toward The SWAT squad.  CAMERA MOVING ACROSS THE FACES OF ELLIE, TOMMY, MIKE... and KOONTZ; all holding in place. Listening to them come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the sirens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you they'd be here in a few minutes. The grim humor of it is registered in SILENCE.  MIKE pick up VENZA'S HUNTING KNIFE from the floor, cutting through the ropes that bind TOMMY'S and ELLIE'S HANDS; she PULLS TOMMY to HER, in a tearful EMBRACE, shielding his face from the ghastly sight of the man, lying dead, on the floor. OTHER PEOPLE are MOVING INWARD, CLAIRE among them, clad i an OVERSIZED POLICE OVERCOAT -- looking frail and frightened, SHUDDERING WITH RELIEF when she sees that all are safe.  But there is no mistaking the presence of something else in her eyes. CLOSE ON CLAIRE'S FACE:  gazing at MIKE, his family wrapped in his protective embrace.  He LOOKS UP, meeting her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's all right...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  It's all over. LONG ANGLE on the ROOM:  dimly illuminated by the single light, shed from the opened refrigerator door, as people begin to move -- awakening to life, and its necessary details, in the aftermath of the crisis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LAWN virtually FILLED with POLICE VEHICLES, their revolving red lights illuminating the grim scene; a small gathering of onlookers gawking from behind police ropes, AMBULANCES pulling SLOWLY, SILENTLY, away. CAMERA PANS to two figures ALONE, beside a squad car, in the distant shadows.  It's CLAIRE, still clad in the police overcoat, and MIKE.  They are together, but separate, maintaining the proper distance to say goodbye. CLOSER ANGLE ON THEM:  not knowing quite what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. ANGLE ON BOTH:  their eyes locked into each other's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still going away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's probably still a good idea. CLOSE ON MIKE:  getting her message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Both are hurting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heartfelt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll miss you, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'll... see you again. Her eyes are glistening; she gives him a bracing smile. But he can't quiet manage it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely able to speak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say goodbye. He struggles with it; unable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half-laugh, half-cry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a weakness for Lady Cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Silence now; their eyes adoring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say goodbye, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thick voiced)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take care. MIKE TURNS -- CAMERA MOVING WITH HIM as he WALKS SLOWLY AWAY -- finding himself on a collision course with GARBER They meet, spending a long moment in non-communicative greeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any chance?  There's nothin' else I'm any good at, but this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noncommittal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me next week.  We'll talk about it. MIKE absorbs it, looking up to SEE ELLIE and TOMMY, besid a SQUAD CAR, a distance away.  Girding himself, he HEADS TOWARD. ANGLE ON ELLIE AND TOMMY -- as he APPROACHES, and stands beside them.  Not much to say.  Finally he reaches out an tousles TOMMY'S hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good police work, kiddo. He catches ELLIE'S eye, both assessing each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Tommy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't want to sleep here. (a long beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I.  It's not my house anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. ANGLE ON ALL:  finding each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's find some place to start over. MIKE puts an arm AROUND TOMMY -- and the CAMERA BEGINS A LONG PULLBACK, as ELLIE moves to his side, and the KEEGAN FAMILY begins to MOVE AWAY.  WE SEE CLAIRE, being helped into a SQUAD CAR, turning to look back at them as it PULL AWAY -- CARS REVVING UP and PULLING OUT, in ALL DIRECTIONS. From a distance, we HEAR MIKE'S VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ellie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What this crap about singing lessons?
